saf.core.ui

Class GUIBarManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • saf.core.ui.GUIBarManager

  • public class GUIBarManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Managers menu, tool and status bar configuration and manipulation. The toolbar is divided into named groups divided by separators. This allows buttons to be grouped in the toolbar.
    Author:
    Nick Collier

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GUIBarManager(javax.swing.JToolBar toolBar, javax.swing.JMenuBar menuBar)
      Creates a GUIBarManager managing the specified tool and menu bars.

        Sets the font of the specified status field.
        Parameters:

        font - the new font for the status bar field

      • getStatusBarTextColor

        public java.awt.Color getStatusBarTextColor(java.lang.String statusFieldName)
        Gets the foreground (eg text color) of the specified status field.
        Parameters:
        statusFieldName - the status field whose color we want to get
        Returns:
        the foreground (eg text color) of the specified status field, or null if the name status field is not found

      • setStatusBarText

        public void setStatusBarText(java.lang.String statusFieldName,
                    java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text of the specified status field. If the actual status bar component is not a text field this will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        statusFieldName - the status field whose text we want to set.
        text - the text to put in the status field
